alert.note: Alert for Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:22PM EST until December 20 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall runoff continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1120 PM EST, Emergency management reported heavy rain runoff flooding and road closures in Piscataquis County near Medford and Monson. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 3 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dover-Foxcroft, Dexter, Greenville, Guilford, Monson, Blanchard, Elliottsville, Kingsbury Plantation, Frenchtown, Sangerville, Garland, Parkman, Abbot, Wellington, Shirley, Willimantic, Beaver Cove, Bowerbank, Kingsbury and Onawa. - The Piscataquis River at Blanchard is at moderate flood stage and slowly falling but is causing rural flooding impacts in the area. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
